l
The area brightens.
[Trail.]

The trail abruptly disappears into a dense wall of foggy mist. The ground here is soggy. Each step sets off a cacophony of buzzing insects, accompanied by the squelching sound of boots being grabbed by slimy muck.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

[Trail.]

The trail skirts the border of the dismal marsh. Noxious vapors rise from the stagnant waters that lap at the noticeably narrowing route. What had been a dark green haze can now be distinguished as a massive forest.

l
The area brightens.
[Riverside.]

The footbridge that once connected this path to its match on the other side of the overflowing rushing river is now nothing more then a few charred pilings. Tiny insects buzz around their remains, finding a comfortable new home. Lashed to the remains of one of the more sturdy pilings is a tall steel pole. Wrapped around the pole, and tied securely is a taut rope. Bobbing ever so lightly due to the strain of the riverboat, the rope holds tight.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, and some carved oak benches are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human.

l at no

Noffbrau looks like a 3'9" standard young light boned, average bodied Hithual.
He has very long, tied back, wispy platinum blonde hair with a long beard, pitch black eyes, and looks razor-sharp.
He appears to be confused right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his upper left forearm is a tattoo of a ruby-eyed golden winged dragon.

On his lower left forearm is a tattoo of a majestic blue ruby sword.

On his right arm is a tattoo of intricately etched blue dragon scales that cover his arm from his wrist to his shoulder.

On his neck, at the back, is a scarred-over brand that reads SA.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

thirsty for another ale

[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, a large pool of mud, and a riverboat are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing lantern), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).

[Bubbling forest stream.]

The path here turns due west, climbing the river bank towards taller evergreen trees. The river rumbles loudly, singing its ancient tune. North of the river, fir and cedar begin to dominate while the deciduous varieties fade.  Some fresh flowering sprouts are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st snow spotted owl and the 1st wolf.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).

You follow Solinus west...

[Forest Path.]

The path continues to the west through a mix of moss covered Fir and Alder trees. Further to the west, taller trees designate the incline of a hill. All around the trunks of the taller trees, a large patch of glossy leafed ivy spreads over the burned remains of the old city.  Several charred planks lay in piles under the proliferous ivy as nature's cycle of renewal chews, burrows, disintegrates and mulches the wood back to the soil.  Some mossy Fir trees and some majestic ivy covered Alder trees are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: east* west.

You follow Solinus west...

[Forest Path.]

The path forks around the hill to the northwest and southwest. The hill definitely makes you uneasy, especially when you notice its unnatural regularity. The undergrowth is so thick it prevents you from climbing the hill.  A thick undergrowth is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: east* southwest northwest.

You follow Solinus northwest...

[Forest Path.]

The path forks to the northwest and northeast. You spot the tracks of a deer, and looking around, notice the antler-scraped bark of a nearby tree. The healthy smell of the forest surrounds you, but the hill to the southwest keeps you from enjoying it.  A broken and cracked steelwood tree is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast* northwest.

You follow Solinus northwest...

[Forest path.]

The breeze is coming from the north, yet a feeling of dread comes from the south, down the loathsome hill, along a series of rock carved steps.  The forest is unnaturally quiet, as you peer up to the top of the hill.  Some steps leading up are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest.

You follow Solinus southwest...

[Forest path.]

You step over a small rivulet of water running down from the hill here. The stream seems to be reviving, and even small insects flitter about, but quickly scurry away.  The forest here is eerily still, and you hope this path is going to lead away from this hill soon.  A small flowing rivulet is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dirge.

[Branch in forest path.]

The path branches, leading off in three directions here. The trees here, begin to become more deciduous as you go south. Ferns brush at your feet as you walk. Tangles of blackberries looking quite good, grow on the hill. Dare you eat them?

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast west.

You follow Solinus west...

[Forest path.]

The path here is wide and seems to be underlaid with stone. Looking closer, the stone seems to be laid out in a regular pattern.  Perhaps this is the remains of a road. You wonder where it leads as a wolf howls mournfully in the distance.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st giant caterpillar.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: east* west.

You follow Solinus west...

[Forest End]

The trees end suddenly as you have come to an immensely wide canyon.  A bridge at one time led across to the other side.  Now, however, the bridge is broken and looks to be beyond repair. Across the ravine you see nothing but rock and barren landscape.  A crumbling bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).
Obvious paths: east*.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Feletia the Draco, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern).

[Bubbling forest stream.]

The path here turns due west, climbing the river bank towards taller evergreen trees. The river rumbles loudly, singing its ancient tune. North of the river, fir and cedar begin to dominate while the deciduous varieties fade.  Some fresh flowering sprouts are here.

The area brightens.
[Forest Path.]

The path continues to the west through a mix of moss covered Fir and Alder trees. Further to the west, taller trees designate the incline of a hill. All around the trunks of the taller trees, a large patch of glossy leafed ivy spreads over the burned remains of the old city.  Several charred planks lay in piles under the proliferous ivy as nature's cycle of renewal chews, burrows, disintegrates and mulches the wood back to the soil.  Some mossy Fir trees and some majestic ivy covered Alder trees are here.

The area brightens.
[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. Three giant boulders fill what was once an immense hole in the ground.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a sticky rotting wyvern head, a slimy oozing wyvern torso, and a giant dark green decaying wyvern carcass are here.

[Stone barrow entrance.]

Twin sconces illuminate a faded green and black tapestry hanging on the wall opposite the entrance. Upon closer examination it seems to be the standard of a long dead king. A long keening wail resounds off the hard stone walls.  A faded green and black standard, a crevice, and an exit are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Stone barrow.]

Handlaid stone and broad timbers comprise the walls of this barrow.  At regular intervals, niches, two feet high and seven feet long, have been constructed on either side of the wall.  They stand empty. But, if they are empty, why were they made?

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st skeletal guard.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing lantern), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: east* southwest west.

The swing misses its target.

[Stone barrow]

The decaying corpse of another adventurer lies here, stripped of skin. What made him choose to cling to his deity and not return? Or, perhaps, his soul never made it that far.  Shuffling and scraping noises come from all around you.  A rotting corpse of a go-blin-al is here.

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. Three giant boulders fill what was once an immense hole in the ground.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a sticky rotting wyvern head, a slimy oozing wyvern torso, and a giant dark green decaying wyvern carcass are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Barren Fields]

A black stone structure clings precipitously to the edge of a large cliff. The drop-off of several thousand feet cuts off any further travel north or westward. The painfully cold wind whips your clothing about you as it gusts in a frigid blast from the canyon beneath.  A gateway is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Monastery Ruins, Upper Level]

The empty but intact shelves against the far wall stand in sharp contrast to the rest of the broken furnishing in the room.  The remains of a couple of bookstands lie beneath the shelves, overturned and severely scarred.  Strangely, even after looking through the rubble, there is not a book to be seen anywhere.  A closed ancient wooden door, an open scarred wooden door, and an archway are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st greater moaning spirit.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: None.

>[Monastery Ruins, Upper Level]

The empty but intact shelves against the far wall stand in sharp contrast to the rest of the broken furnishing in the room.  The remains of a couple of bookstands lie beneath the shelves, overturned and severely scarred.  Strangely, even after looking through the rubble, there is not a book to be seen anywhere.  A closed ancient wooden door, a closed scarred wooden door, and an archway are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: None.
>
You follow Owynn through an archway...


l
The area brightens.
[Monastery Ruins, Upper Level]

The upper portion of a large, dead tree stretches through the middle of this room. Its trunk reaches through the opening in the floor, shooting straight upward and piercing the ceiling. Dozens of broken branches are scattered about the otherwise empty room, probably fallen from the wind that howls in through the arch to the north.  An archway, an archway, an archway, and an archway are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st firian warrior spirit and the 2nd firian warrior spirit.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: None.

A large statue once stood vigil on this rocky outcropping overlooking the gorge. The remains of the once imposing figure lie scattered about, some lost forever to the depths of the chasm.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and some flowering jasmine vines are here.

[Hope's Path.]

A fine haze of dust hovers over the remains of the Silver Owl Inn. Through the fallen timbers and memories of lives lost, one can see brilliant green sprouts reaching for sunlight. The area brightens.
[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Owynn east...

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north east south west*.

You follow Owynn north...


l
The area brightens.
[Bramble Hedge.]

This small offshoot of the tunnel through the brambles runs in several directions, none of them very appealing to those with exposed skin. The bones of a few small animals litter the ground, animals once trapped in the thorns stuck to die. A small sapling fights its way into existence, desperately trying to escape the chokehold of the brushes not burned out from the recent fires.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north northeast east south* southwest west northwest.
[Bramble Hedge.]

This small offshoot of the tunnel through the brambles runs in several directions, none of them very appealing to those with exposed skin. The bones of a few small animals litter the ground, animals once trapped in the thorns stuck to die. A small sapling fights its way into existence, desperately trying to escape the chokehold of the brushes not burned out from the recent fires.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north northeast east south* southwest west northwest.
>
Owynn says, "search if you like, but it should be obvious here"

Solinus says, "Quite deep in the forest, it is possible if things happened quickly enough it could have been disguised. By whom I've no idea."

Alwin searches the area.

You follow Owynn north...


l
The area brightens.
[Bramble Hedge.]

Thorny bushes threaten to eradicate all life passing by them as they reach out to poke anything that strays too close. Through small holes, vague shapes of trees can be seen outside the brambles offering hope to an end of the sharp pricks accompanied with passing through here. The path through is only clear due to a forest fire that previously swept through the area.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

The area brightens.
[Thin forest.]

The brambles clear out considerably, much of the greedy foliage burned out to permit the freshly planted saplings a chance at thriving. Remains of an unnatural fire give away the purposeful intent to remove the intrusive thorns. Not yet as tall as an elf, the young trees struggle to survive nature's rough surroundings. The loving care, provided by the forest's inhabitants, will go a long way in helping the saplings to grow strong and beautiful.  A leaf covered steelwood sprout is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Thin Forest.]

The ground is nearly a perfect carpet of green grass, adding to what is already a breathtaking sight. Evenly spaced apart, young saplings reach for the sky, grasping for the nourishment of the sun during the daylight hours. The lush forest floor vegetation helps protect the saplings from invading insects; the grass requiring far less maintenance and providing the tiny six-legged crawlers with sufficient food.  A young healthy oak tree is here.

In the area are Vallek the Frontacian, Autumn the Fir Elf, Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: northeast south.

[Poacher camp.]

An appalling mixture of sludge, blood and offal oozes downhill from the campsite, leaving an offensive slick in its wake. The thick reeking mud emits a nauseating stench, enough to make one's eyes water. The slide creates a blackened dead-zone in the otherwise green and healthy forest.

[Poacher camp.]

The peaceful activity and semi-darkness of the forest is interrupted with strange sounds and an unusual brightness beyond. A light breeze carries a distinctly repugnant charnel odor. The drone of insects and the rustling of small animals is concentrated in this small area. The short grasses and understory bushes are trampled into large game tracks, darkened streaks in the forest carpet. Tufts of fur, strips of avulsed skin and thick blood clots cling to the ends of some of the branches. Something small but ferocious snarls loudly and the bushes rustle with the sounds of retreat.

The area brightens.
[Poacher camp.]

Canine howls and whines ring loud and clear as a mangy, matted mongrel strains at its frayed tether. The dog's frothing muzzle is pointed at a squirming pile of putrid animal skin, just out of reach. A quick movement punctuated by snarls and growling draws your eyes as small dark shadows dash for cover. Two of the braver rodents pointedly ignore the mongrel and  duke it out in true feral combat, their tiny teeth bared over a choice tidbit as the dog feverishly digs in the dirt trying to get at the tiny scavengers.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Poacher camp.]

A curtain of well-placed branches and leaves camouflages a creaky old wagon. The rotting boards support rough pine crates, piles of smashed barrel staves, poorly sewn sacks of rock salt and jars of vile smelling liquids. Supplies of all types lay tossed about with little order. The lid of a thick oak box lays askance, revealing a set of nasty looking knives and bone saws. Nearby, a hobbled, skinny mule pulls at tufts of grass with its long, yellow teeth. Its cruel master has left a harness strapped to the poor beast, prepared for a quick getaway. Clouds of flies pester the ancient mule, her back a mosaic of open festering sores and old scars from years of neglect.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: southeast south southwest west*.

Standing in this rank is:
Glinka
>[Poacher camp.]

A curtain of well-placed branches and leaves camouflages a creaky old wagon. The rotting boards support rough pine crates, piles of smashed barrel staves, poorly sewn sacks of rock salt and jars of vile smelling liquids. Supplies of all types lay tossed about with little order. The lid of a thick oak box lays askance, revealing a set of nasty looking knives and bone saws. Nearby, a hobbled, skinny mule pulls at tufts of grass with its long, yellow teeth. Its cruel master has left a harness strapped to the poor beast, prepared for a quick getaway. Clouds of flies pester the ancient mule, her back a mosaic of open festering sores and old scars from years of neglect.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: southeast south southwest west.
>
Renalk searches the area.

You follow Owynn southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Poacher camp.]

The windward side of the camp is sheltered by few large overhanging ferns. Woven grass sleeping mats and rumpled blankets are still strewn about from the poacher's last night of sleep, shaded by the giant fronds. A pile of greasy bones lay next to the pallets, drawing the interest of insects and other small scavengers.  Some rolled grass sleeping mats are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Feletia the Draco, Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: southwest west northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[Poacher camp.]

Using the campfire smoke as an insect repellent, the poachers did the finer work of cleaning various animal parts closer to the fire. Several logs bear marks where their blades were cleaned and wiped of the results of their work. Piles of bones and bits of hide with hair or fur still attached lay off to the sides, too small or damaged to be of any value. Several shining bits of metal lay partially hidden in the grass, the wasteful nature of the poachers evident in all things. A few intact blades lay buried hilt deep in the bloody muck, rusting around the edges from a lack of care.  A large worn whetstone is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wasteful poacher and the 2nd wasteful poacher.

[Poacher camp.]

Though most of the larger animals are left to waste in the forest, smaller ones are brought back to the camp for dissection. The amount of waste in the butchering is striking. Around the fringe of the camp, an entire herd of carcasses bloat angrily, each with only specific body parts missing. Stinking piles of decomposing flesh lay rotting near rocks and logs where the poachers sat to finish their grizzly jobs. Legions of flies infest the clearing.

This area is illuminated.

[Poacher camp.]

An appalling mixture of sludge, blood and offal oozes downhill from the campsite, leaving an offensive slick in its wake. The thick reeking mud emits a nauseating stench, enough to make one's eyes water. The slide creates a blackened dead-zone in the otherwise green and healthy forest.

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian (flying beside you), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north east* south west.

You follow Owynn south...

You follow Autumn north...

[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, and a long woven moonsilver cord are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north east south* west.
You search the area thoroughly.

You find nothing of interest.

The area brightens.
[Bramble Hedge.]

This small offshoot of the tunnel through the brambles runs in several directions, none of them very appealing to those with exposed skin. The bones of a few small animals litter the ground, animals once trapped in the thorns stuck to die. A small sapling fights its way into existence, desperately trying to escape the chokehold of the brushes not burned out from the recent fires.

The area brightens.
[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: east*.
[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and some flowering jasmine vines are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: east.
>

[Caersech Forest.]

The western bank is steep and rocky. In some places, it has collapsed, exposing the immense roots of the oaks nearest the stream. The stream widens and its waters become deeper. The gentle flow has become a strong current.   A stone bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Caersech Forest.]

[Ravine.]

A narrow strip of mud separates the cliff face from the churning waters at the bottom of the falls. A misty spray soaks this path that terminates at a deep blue pool to the south. Continuing north, the path disappears into a muddy bog.  A rotting hemp rope and a muddy path to the bog are here.

The area brightens.
[Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. A rock shelf rests a few feet above the pool, housing an inviting combination of moss and clover.  A beautiful flowing waterfall, a deep blue pool, and a soft mossy patch of clover are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

The area brightens.
[Shadow Caves.]

Oddly shaped yellow rocks line the entrance to the cave. Sharp and jagged, they jut from the cave floor, forming a semi-circle. Protruding from the rather low ceiling of the cave are more rocks in a matching formation.  The effect is that of stalagmites and stalactites, striving to meet. The floor of the cave is littered with rock fragments, making passage slow and difficult.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

[Shadow Caves.]

The stone walls have been blackened and rippled where they were melted by fierce heat. The charred bone planks in some places are embedded deep within solid stone. [Shadow Caves.]

The stone walls have been blackened and rippled where they were melted by fierce heat. The charred bone planks in some places are embedded deep within solid stone. [Shadow Caves.]

The stone walls have been blackened and rippled where they were melted by fierce heat. The charred bone planks in some places are embedded deep within solid stone. The odd layout of the caves begins to make you feel that were the caves alive, you would be in the belly of a great beast and had gained entry through its once-powerful jaws.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious exits: northeast southwest west.
>You are now following Owynn.

 ** Current fatigue: 59 out of 65

You follow Owynn west...


l
The area brightens.
[Shadow Caves.]

The narrower cave gives way to a huge cavern. The ceiling is lost to view in the dark shadows, and the far wall is barely visible. The yellow planks are wider and longer, but here dark streaks mar the smooth texture. A closer look at the shoring reveals that what appeared to be a pattern of dark stains is the blackened evidence of fire, and that the planks are made of bone.  A small simple amber bead is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious exits: north east*.

The area brightens.
[Shadow Caves.]

Oddly shaped yellow rocks line the entrance to the cave. Sharp and jagged, they jut from the cave floor, forming a semi-circle. Protruding from the rather low ceiling of the cave are more rocks in a matching formation.  The effect is that of stalagmites and stalactites, striving to meet. The floor of the cave is littered with rock fragments, making passage slow and difficult.

This room is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. A rock shelf rests a few feet above the pool, housing an inviting combination of moss and clover.  A beautiful flowing waterfall, a deep blue pool, and a soft mossy patch of clover are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st large shadow.

[Muddy Bog.]

A bog spreads out to the north and east, sheltered by the high walls of a ravine. The western edge of the bog melts into a deep lake fed by a rushing waterfall. Beside the path, an ancient snapping turtle rises to the surface of a stagnant muddy pool. After a brief breath of air, he disappears into the murky depths.  A path to the waterfall is here.

[Muddy Bog.]

Leafy tree branches hang so low that they rest on the surface of the scummy water. Brightly colored dragonflies dart between them, their glistening bodies a welcome change to the brown, murky bog. The clearer water of the lake drifts in from the west, keeping the bog moist all year round.

[Muddy Bog.]

A rotting log, home to several winged insects, spans a large pool of murky water that lies between the limestone walls of the ravine. [Muddy Bog.]

Several painted arrow shafts stick up out of the path at crazy angles, suggesting some kind of crude hunter's marker. [Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

[Muddy Bog.]

A subtle under-current pulls the standing reeds to lean slightly south with their leaves trailing down into the water. A large rock lizard flicks its tongue into the air as it scuttles up onto a large rock in pursuit of its dinner. Parts of the rock seem to move as the lizard abruptly vanishes into its depths. After a brief silence following a large gulping sound, the cacaphony of insects returns to its normal volume.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west.

[Muddy Bog.]

Travel through the deep-bog is rather difficult at this section as the thick, sludgy water is as high as a human's waist. Some fallen, rotting logs jut up from underneath, providing needed handholds. [Muddy Bog.]

Thick, slimy bubbles emerge to the surface of the deep bog and burst with a sickening sound that startles the prey of a nearby snake into hopping away at the last second. Low-hanging cypress branches shade the already dark waters, making them appear much more sinister than the surrounding bog. Somehow life still must go on here,as the splashing of fish diving beneath the exposed roots of the trees can still be heard.

[Muddy Bog.]

Muddy footprints lead from the deeper waters of the bog up toward the edge of the muck.  Oddly enough, there are no footprints coming the other way, as if some large creature crawled out of the sludge to shore. Tiny winged insects buzz all around you, creating eerie harmonies with their wings. [Muddy Bog.]

[Muddy Bog.]

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A well worn path clings to the base of the ravine wall, the riot of reeds and rushes threatening to claim it. Recently laid deer tracks come to an abrupt end at a site of obvious struggle. The bent stalks of marsh grasses indicate the direction the unlucky animal was dragged, with bits of bloody fur littering its path. On the ravine wall, some jokester has written in fading chalk, "No swimming allowed."

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north east southwest* west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

A rocky path skirts the base of a sheer limestone cliff. Despite the unstable footing on the loose stone, this path is far quicker than slogging through the dangerous bog. Tiny pebbles click against the trail as they lose their place in the rock wall, leaving small niches in the jagged surface. To the northwest, the size of the fallen rocks is noticeably larger.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: southeast south* southwest west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Muddy Bog.]

As the elevation drops to the west, this muddy bog gives way to a large lake. Clear paths are visible along the walls of the ravine to both the southwest and northwest, venturing to the center of the bog will require careful foot placement to avoid the stagnant pools and deep muck. Walking through the dark waters that pools atop the sludge beneath can prove dangerous for even the most sure-footed hunter.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing pale blue flame), Alwin the Secian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human, Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

[Forest End]

The trees end suddenly as you have come to an immensely wide canyon.  A bridge at one time led across to the other side.  Now, however, the bridge is broken and looks to be beyond repair. Across the ravine you see nothing but rock and barren landscape.  A crumbling bridge is here.

[Forest End]

The trees end suddenly as you have come to an immensely wide canyon.  A bridge at one time led across to the other side.  Now, however, the bridge is broken and looks to be beyond repair. Across the ravine you see nothing but rock and barren landscape.  A crumbling bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and some flowering jasmine vines are here.

Noffbrau looks like a 3'9" standard young light boned, average bodied Hithual.
He has very long, tied back, wispy platinum blonde hair with a long beard, pitch black eyes, and looks razor-sharp.
He appears to be confused right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his upper left forearm is a tattoo of a ruby-eyed golden winged dragon.

On his lower left forearm is a tattoo of a majestic blue ruby sword.

On his right arm is a tattoo of intricately etched blue dragon scales that cover his arm from his wrist to his shoulder.

On his neck, at the back, is a scarred-over brand that reads SA.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

thirsty for another ale

    The giant praying mantis is knocked back!

The blisters across the giant praying mantis's body burst painfully!

Fiery ripples of heat begin to trail from Renalk's fingertips.

Solinus swings his shimmering golden emiel holy lance at the giant praying mantis!
The swing goes wild.

Autumn fires her softly glimmering moonsilver crescent longbow at the giant praying mantis!
The shot is a nearly perfect blow to the left arm.

The giant praying mantis dies while attempting to fly away.

Alwin returns his brass knuckles.

[Lupine Village.]

The hut before you is larger than any you've seen in the entire village.  The wooden door, the only one of all the huts, is carved with reliefs of battles between lupines and somewhat amorphous creatures that remind you of shadows.  Someone, or something, important must live here.  An open wooden door is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lupine spirit warrior.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north west northwest.
>
You follow Owynn west...


A lupine spirit warrior enters, following Owynn's group.

[Lupine Village.]

You stand before a low hut built near the edge of the forest.  The walls are plastered mud, and the roof is well thatched.  In front of the entrance is a tanned hide flap, and behind the flap is a lupine with a long dagger growling at you.  You think it would be best not to try to intrude.

[Deep Forest.]

This area is illuminated.

In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: east* southeast.

[Spider Web.]

Several feet beneath you, a few forest orks scavenge remains of anything that has fallen from above. You notice that most carry small sacks within which they keep any valuables they may find. As one of the orks notices you, he bellows loudly and dashes out of sight followed closely by the others. Maybe they have mistaken you for one of the inhabitants of the web.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north east southeast*.

l
The area brightens.
[Spider Web.]

As you look at what lies before you a feeling somewhere between amazment and terror fills your mind.  You're standing at the anchor point of what you can easily admit to be the largest spider web you have ever seen.  Huge strands of silk extend to symmetrical anchor points around the web.  These strands show no sign of adhesive material, they are simply the foundation for which the rest is built on.  You feel that with a fair amount of caution you could walk on it.  Behind you, the passage out has been sealed closed once again.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

[Caersech Forest.]

Exercising caution, you slice your way through the thick webbing.  Slowly, you move forward knowing that should you come into contact with the web you may never be able to leave.  An unfamiliar sound eminates from behind you.  As you turn you see large, dark figures moving back and forth, replacing that which you've attempted to destroy.  A long broken wooden spear is here.

The area brightens.
[Caersech Forest.]

A wide gap within the line of trees which encircle the clearing has been spanned with thick strands of spider-silk.  A closer look reveals small particles of dust, as well as leaves stuck to the strands.  From the size of webbing you imagine that the strength and adhesion would be too great to escape from.  Perhaps cutting through with a blade would allow travel to the west.

[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. [Caersech Forest.]

[Treehaven, Glen.]

The rush of the water nearby has become a constant companion in expansive maze of trees, evergreens and sub-vegetation. The changing surroundings blend into a repetitive pallete of natural hues.

The area brightens.
[Treehaven, Glen.]

The natural sounds of the forest intertwine in a natural symphonic arrangement of chirps, squeaks, howls and hoots of the various creatures that populate this ancient glen. The busy animals follow their daily routines while keeping a wary eye on the intruders of their private forest. Intent beady eyes frequently peer out from the underbrush, then scurry back into the relative safety of the darkness.

The area brightens.
[Treehaven, Glen.]

Whispering ancient lore of powerful foresters, the wind returns those secrets to a new generation here in the Caersech. Thick with moss and leaves, a web of vines interconnects the branches above. Their varying thicknesses are suitable for a great number of tree-dwelling creatures to navigate the lush canopy. Several large jagged boulders, to the north of the glen, are piled on top of each other. Flowing crystal water pushes its way over the top of them creating a misting waterfall and a pool of water below. Winding its way north, a large flowing stream creates moisture in the air which is rich with the aroma of long-forgotten forests.  A pile of jagged boulders, a waterfall, and a large flowing stream are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

[Treehaven, Glen.]

The rocky ground reveals the slow, unrelenting erosion of decades. A fallen tree nearly spans the turbulent water from this southern bank, its slippery surface covered in moss. The deep hole caused by the uprooted giant makes an ideal home for a frolicking river otter.

The area brightens.
[Treehaven, Glen.]

The roaring sound of the river overwhelms most other sounds as one travels along the rocky path that shadows its serpentine shape. A small chunk of wood swiftly passes, bobbing on the foamy rapids. Large, smooth rocks are piled near the riverbank, by an ancient flood. A deweybird hops among them, looking for some juicy waterbugs. Along the side of the river, a small cottage stands boarded up. The ivy has over grown around the gate and the mailbox door is hanging from one hinge.  A damaged old ivy-covered gate boarded up and a damaged sapphire blue mailbox are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

[Treehaven, Glen.]

The thick vegetation and the massive trees thin as one moves from the main path. A small clearing appears, a place where travelers can rest or camp overnight. A few markings on some nearby tree trunks tell the story of deer racks and bear claws being cleaned. Scampering across the path, a tiny, long-eared chipmunk holds an acorn in its teeth for future storage. Other than the sounds of his crunching, the clearing is quiet and peaceful.

The area brightens.
[Caersech Forest.]

Fallen maidenhair trees now provide a home for the various wildlife in the area. A small patch of wild mushrooms can be seen growing underneath one of the fallen trees. A young maidenhair tree, now several feet high, has grown gracefully up between its fallen parents. Several patches of clover create a lush cushion at the base of the tree and boast several lovely purple flowers. Set carefully at the edge of the forest, a small thatched hut has been built. A small plume of smoke rises from the tiny chimney that rests on the roof.  A healthy green patch of clover, some fallen maidenhair trees, a young maidenhair tree, some wild mushrooms, and an open leaf carved pine door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Autumn the Fir Elf, Alwin the Secian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Owynn the Fir Elf, and Solinus the Human.

>[Secluded Shrine.]

The path leads into a tiny glade at the edge of the stream hidden by the graceful swaying branches of several large willow trees. Near the stream's bank stands a marble font covered with vines of fragrant purple and white blossoms. A soft white glow emanates from the small ivory dove statue set into the center of the font's crystal basin. A cool, refreshing breeze wafts through the branches of the ancient willows, filling the area with a sense of peaceful tranquility.  A small path under the willows, some white marble benches, some glowing white ceremonial candles, a flowering vine-covered marble font, and a cracked ivory offering bowl are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. [Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and some flowering jasmine vines are here.

>[Hope's Path.]

A fine haze of dust hovers over the remains of the Silver Owl Inn. Through the fallen timbers and memories of lives lost, one can see brilliant green sprouts reaching for sunlight. A tiny songbird perches on an old stick of furniture poking through the rubble, singing sweetly to herald new life and hope. A small winding path of stones placed in the shape of four leaf clovers winds itself through the forest.  A small winding stone pathway and a charred flowering steelwood tree are here.

>[Caersech Forest.]

Small wildflowers and large tufts of grass cover the ground around the well-worn path that winds across the forest floor. A number of young saplings sprout eagerly from the ground around the remains of a once tall maidenhair. Standing beside the path is the Merchant's Pavilion, nestled comfortably among the brush.  An open pine door, a large green silk tent, some colorful wild flowers, and a tiny delicate maidenhair sprout are here.

[Treehaven Pavilion.]

The smell of fresh-cut pine fills your nose as you enter the building.  Fresh boughs hang from rafters that are not too far above your head, lending their scent to keeping the pavilion smelling fresh. The majority of the building is taken up by a commons area of packed dirt in the center where customers and merchants alike can see what is being bought and sold all around.  An open blackened pine door and an open elegant carved rosewood door are here.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The thick sub-layer of the forests flora casts eerie shadows that move like a living force. The rich sound of flowing water nearby makes the birdcalls from the tall maidenhair trees that surround the path sound distant. A light breeze passes across the branches of the trees, swaying and moving them in a gentle dance.  A winding path is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast.
ne
>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The thick vegetation and the massive trees thin as one moves from the main path. A small clearing appears, a place where travelers can rest or camp overnight. A few markings on some nearby tree trunks tell the story of deer racks and bear claws being cleaned. Scampering across the path, a tiny, long-eared chipmunk holds an acorn in its teeth for future storage. Other than the sounds of his crunching, the clearing is quiet and peaceful.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southwest* northwest.
n
>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The pungent, sylvan air of centuries condenses all around. The tall pines and ancient maidenhair trees have thick, strong trunks that have withstood season after season of natural and unnatural assaults. Strong roots grow in gnarled tangles, threatening to trip those that pass.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south* west.
n
>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The rocky ground reveals the slow, unrelenting erosion of decades. A fallen tree nearly spans the turbulent water from this southern bank, its slippery surface covered in moss. The deep hole caused by the uprooted giant makes an ideal home for a frolicking river otter.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The rush of the water nearby has become a constant companion in expansive maze of trees, evergreens and sub-vegetation. The erratic path leads deeper within this fortress of massive trees and hesitates in spots, at times turning east only to then take a tangent west. The changing surroundings blend into a repetitive pallete of natural hues.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south southwest* west northwest.
n
>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The natural sounds of the forest intertwine in a natural symphonic arrangement of chirps, squeaks, howls and hoots of the various creatures that populate this ancient glen. The busy animals follow their daily routines while keeping a wary eye on the intruders of their private forest. Intent beady eyes frequently peer out from the underbrush, then scurry back into the relative safety of the darkness.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest west.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

Whispering ancient lore of powerful foresters, the wind returns those secrets to a new generation here in the Caersech. Thick with moss and leaves, a web of vines interconnects the branches above. Their varying thicknesses are suitable for a great number of tree-dwelling creatures to navigate the lush canopy. Several large jagged boulders, to the north of the glen, are piled on top of each other. Flowing crystal water pushes its way over the top of them creating a misting waterfall and a pool of water below. Winding its way north, a large flowing stream creates moisture in the air which is rich with the aroma of long-forgotten forests.  A pile of jagged boulders, a waterfall, and a large flowing stream are here.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The roaring sound of the river overwhelms most other sounds as one travels along the rocky path that shadows its serpentine shape. A small chunk of wood swiftly passes, bobbing on the foamy rapids. Large, smooth rocks are piled near the riverbank, by an ancient flood. A deweybird hops among them, looking for some juicy waterbugs. Along the side of the river, a small cottage stands boarded up. The ivy has over grown around the gate and the mailbox door is hanging from one hinge.  A damaged old ivy-covered gate boarded up and a damaged sapphire blue mailbox are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The roaring sound of the river overwhelms most other sounds as one travels along the rocky path that shadows its serpentine shape. A small chunk of wood swiftly passes, bobbing on the foamy rapids. Large, smooth rocks are piled near the riverbank, by an ancient flood. A deweybird hops among them, looking for some juicy waterbugs. Along the side of the river, a small cottage stands boarded up. The ivy has over grown around the gate and the mailbox door is hanging from one hinge.  A damaged old ivy-covered gate boarded up and a damaged sapphire blue mailbox are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast east southeast.

>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The thick vegetation and the massive trees thin as one moves from the main path. A small clearing appears, a place where travelers can rest or camp overnight. A few markings on some nearby tree trunks tell the story of deer racks and bear claws being cleaned. Scampering across the path, a tiny, long-eared chipmunk holds an acorn in its teeth for future storage. Other than the sounds of his crunching, the clearing is quiet and peaceful.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southwest northwest*.
sw
>[Treehaven, Glen.]

The thick sub-layer of the forests flora casts eerie shadows that move like a living force. The rich sound of flowing water nearby makes the birdcalls from the tall maidenhair trees that surround the path sound distant. A light breeze passes across the branches of the trees, swaying and moving them in a gentle dance.  A winding path is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

>[Caersech Forest.]

Fallen maidenhair trees now provide a home for the various wildlife in the area. A small patch of wild mushrooms can be seen growing underneath one of the fallen trees. A young maidenhair tree, now several feet high, has grown gracefully up between its fallen parents. Several patches of clover create a lush cushion at the base of the tree and boast several lovely purple flowers. Set carefully at the edge of the forest, a small thatched hut has been built. A small plume of smoke rises from the tiny chimney that rests on the roof.  A healthy green patch of clover, some fallen maidenhair trees, a young maidenhair tree, some wild mushrooms, and an open leaf carved pine door are here.

>[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, and a large pool of mud are here.

[Hope's Path.]

A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot. [East Trade Road.]

A small orb of light hovers in the center of the path before you, only to disappear as you near it, reappearing further away into the swamp. Stepping near the orb to investigate closer only causes it to again blink out of existence, forming once more, deeper into the mists. It soon becomes apparent that the mysterious lights are attempting to slyly lead you into the swamp. To or for what purpose, is the question.

This area is illuminated.

sw
w
nw
nw
sw
Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.

[East Trade Road.]

Eyes of creatures too quick to be seen monitor your progress along the road. Their footprints can be seen occasionally, leading back and forth across the path, sometimes following along the edges, bringing to mind the vision of something that might be following you, at this very moment, leaving tiny or perhaps not so tiny footprints along the edge of the road as it stalks its prey.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* west.
[East Trade Road.]

A white mile-marking stone rises up from the muck near the path, the numbers etched into its surface gathering moss and sludge in their inner edges. A small marsh rat perches atop the stone, eyeing you hungrily with glittering red orbs, its whiskers twitching nervously at you.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
[East Trade Road.]

The dried trees encroach even up to the roadside, here, their limbs reaching down to the passage as if to snatch the unwary passer-by. A sudden shift in the wind brings forth the sullied aroma of death and decay from the swamp southern lands. Slurpish noises belie the path of some creature traveling through the muddy scape, their movements hidden behind the smoky mist that reduces visibility to a mere few feet past the swamp's edge.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
[East Trade Road.]

The open plains are becoming scattered with scraggly trees, the wood of which proving inefficient to use for building as the elements of nature have grown the trunks so twisted and hard in order to withstand the onslaughts of time. Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest.

The path curves away from the sounds, as popular choice has preferred to travel around the edges, rather than through the marshy sludge.

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  An open iron gate and a rainbow silk tent are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south*.
go gate
>[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open stone gate, a wooden sign, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

>[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

>[Noble Way.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. >[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, a slate grey misty fog, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, a sign above the doors, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

This area is illuminated.

n
n
n
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, and a turkey etched crystal tray are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, and a turkey etched crystal tray are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, a turkey etched crystal tray, and some thick silver-trimmed riding boots are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian (flying 10 feet below you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Korlit the Drag-al.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, a turkey etched crystal tray, and some thick silver-trimmed riding boots are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing pale blue flame), Cleric the Noble Leuian, Faet the Noble Secian, Korlit the Drag-al, Kelthazod the San Elf, Nyoko the Drake, Anyah the Human (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Solinus the Human (holding a flaming golden brass lantern), and Bant the Drake.

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. [Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st panhandler.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
l
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, a turkey etched crystal tray, and some vomit are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Aldous the Usil Elf, Wallace the Noble Flerian, Kelthazod the San Elf, Syntrik the Noble Psycian, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
n
del
