[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

n
>[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Cleric the Noble Leuian (lying down) and Kraggon the Noble Hithual (lying down).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

.

                        Visible Equipment

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a rosewood sign, a turkey etched crystal tray, and some vomit are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Cleric the Noble Leuian, Aldous the Usil Elf, Kelthazod the San Elf, Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Cadiel the Anthian, Anyah the Human, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
se
[Right Street.]

The road between the center of town and the housing district is well kept and maintained. Ruts are immediately repaired and small bushes and flowers line the way. The class of people that travel this way are better dressed and obviously of a higher class. Occasionally guards can be seen taking criminals towards the jail in an efficient and orderly manner.  A street lantern and a pair of open wide mahogany doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cleric of unknown.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

A polished wooden bench sits in front of a neatly trimmed hedge. It is the perfect spot for those who wish to rest and allow their pets or children to play along the grass fronting the roadway. A small stone well complete with a dipper stands ready to slake the thirst of those who travel this way or who need a breather.  A small stone well and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

A neatly trimmed hedge with a small strip of grass fronts the road that travels between the Spurian Housing District and the center of town. A well dressed Frontacian woman hurries along the path as two immaculately dressed Guards lead a criminal towards the jail. She sniffs in a haughty manner, and tips her hat down so she does not have to view the filth of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st calico cat and the 2nd calico cat.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

A large wagon sits on the side of the street, its load having shifted and then toppled over. A Usil driver yells at his two Oog-ra helpers, explaining to them that the armoire should be sitting upright and not on its side. They scratch themselves in confusion, and you can hear them muttering something about leaving it on its side, so it does not fall again. There will be a resident who is unhappy with their purchase this evening.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

Right Street ends at a gateway leading to the Housing and Administration District. Those living in this portion of town travel comfortably either by conveyance or by foot. Beautiful flowers grow on both sides of the well tended, freshly painted gate. In front, standing crisply at attention, a Guard tips his hat in greeting to all those who pass.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northwest*.
go gate
>[Gateway.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Justice District and the Town Square. Most of those heading into the Justice District have a grim look about them. Then again, it could just be the chains. A small sign stands off to the side.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* south*.
se
>[Law Road & Shoteron Way.]

Law Road from the south and Shoteron Way from the east join before turning toward Town Square to the northwest. If one stays at this location long enough, they see the irony of these two roads joining. Most who are escorted south along Law Road are the criminals and ne'er-do-wells of the Spur, while those travel along Shoteron Way are the upper class residents whom live further east. Two office building, the City Planners Office and the Archmage's office stand on opposite sides of the road, each one neatly kept and freshly painted.  A street lantern, an open gilded carved door, and a closed morbius door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.
e
e
>[Shoteron Way.]

A shadowy black twisted free form metal sculpture stands on a small patch of grass at the beginning of Shoteron Way. Its unique design catches the light of both the sun and the moon. Below the memorial are several small items that have been left in passing. The well-manicured cobblestone path shows signs that it is well traveled, with enough room for even the largest cart or Leuian family.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Shoteron Way.]

A low hedge grows between the Spurian Wall and the street. Flowers bloom on the hedge, and cheer up what might be a dreary view. Two guards lean over the tall wall and call down greetings to those who pass. At any time of the day, one may pass a Fir Elf on the way to market, or a Hithual stumbling home to sleep.  A street lantern and an open large wrought iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, a sign above the doors, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, a slate grey misty fog, and a slate grey misty fog are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
go gate
>[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.

>[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
s
[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.
se
se
[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.
[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

s

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.
[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Aldous the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open stone gate, a wooden sign, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  An open iron gate and a rainbow silk tent are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south.

[Road.]

Evidence of recent repairs indicate that any problems are dealt with quickly and competently.  Some dried crimson streaks of blood and a closed old wooden trash wagon are here.
